title: EU proposes moratorium on PTA, till new law comes
byline: The European Union (EU) has inquired about a possible moratorium on the invocation of the Prevention of Terrorism Act (PTA) until it is repealed to be replaced by a new anti-terrorism law, but the government has not yet discussed it, Daily Mirror learns.

title: Handing over PCOL report to CID is an eye wash: Kavinda
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake handing over the report of the Presidential Commission which probed Easter Sunday attacks to the CID is an eye wash as it is not likely to do any good, an Opposition MP said yesterday.

title: We still have hope that truth will be revealed: Catholic Church
byline: The Catholic Church in Sri Lanka still hopes that truth behind the Easter Sunday attacks will be revealed, Member of Communications Committee Archdiocese of Colombo Fr. Cyril Gamini Fernando said yesterday.

title: Scientists claim to have discovered ’new colour’ no one has seen before
byline: A team of scientists claim to have discovered a new colour that no human has ever seen before.

title: Namal accuses Govt of politicising Easter attacks
byline: SLPP MP Namal Rajapaksa accused the current Government of exploiting the 2019 Easter Sunday bomb attacks for political gain ahead of the Local Government elections.

title: Only 14% of ETF members active by end 2024
byline: Only 14.11 percent of member accounts in the Employees’ Trust Fund (ETF) were active at the end of 2024, according to the Central Bank (CB).

title: EPF net worth soars to Rs. 4.37 tn as real returns hit decade high
byline: Sri Lanka’s Employees’ Provident Fund (EPF), the nation’s largest retirement fund, reported a record 12.6 percent year-on-year surge in net worth to Rs. 4.37 trillion by the end of 2024, up from Rs. 3.89 trillion in 2023.

title: Official reserves jump US$ 431mn in March to US$ 6.52bn
byline: Sri Lanka experienced a notable increase in its gross official reserve assets during March 2025, primarily due to the receipt of its fourth programme tranche from the International Monetary Fund (IMF).

title: Easter Sunday’s attacks PCoI report sent to CID for probe on President’s orders
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake has directed the Secretary to the President to hand over the report of the Presidential Commission of Inquiry (PCoI) into the 2019 Easter Sunday’s attacks to the Criminal Investigation Department (CID) for further investigation.

title: Two dead, one injured in accident at Galewela
byline: Two persons died and another was injured in a motorcycle accident on the Galewela–Kurunegala main road after the motorcycle collided with a dog and veered off into a roadside drain.

title: Catalogue of faith proclaimed honouring 167 Easter Sunday victims
byline: A catalogue of faith honouring 167 victims of the Easter Sunday bomb attacks at St. Sebastian’s Church in Katuwapitiya and St. Anthony’s Church in Kochchikade was officially proclaimed today during a ceremony marking the sixth anniversary of the tragedy.

title: Former President arrives at CID over President’s Fund probe
byline: Former President Maithripala Sirisena arrived at the Criminal Investigation Department (CID) today to provide a statement in connection with an ongoing investigation into the alleged misuse of the President’s Fund.

title: Highest single-day complaints related to LG polls recorded
byline: A total of 162 new complaints related to the upcoming Local Government elections were received, marking it the highest number of complaints reported within a 24-hour period since March 20.

title: CA dismisses 20 writ petitions challenging rejection of nominations
byline: The Court of Appeal today ordered the dismissal of about 20 writ petitions filed challenging the rejection of nominations related to the Local Government elections.

title: Pope Francis has died, the Vatican says
byline: Pope Francis, the first Latin American leader of the Roman Catholic Church, has died, the Vatican said in a video statement on Monday, ending an often turbulent reign marked by division and tension as he sought to overhaul the hidebound institution.

title: Visiting hours extended as devotees surge
byline: Over 100,000 devotees have arrived in Kandy today (21), marking the fourth day of the historic exposition of the Sacred Tooth Relic, which is being held after a 16-year hiatus.

title: Restraining order issued on Kotte MC over noise pollution
byline: Colombo Additional Magistrate Manjula Rathnayake issued a conditional restraining order against five individuals, including the Municipal Commissioner of the Sri Jayawardenepura Kotte Municipal Council, prohibiting the use of loudspeakers or sound amplification equipment that causes noise pollution during events held at the Angampitiya Sports Grounds.

title: Quazi Judge arrested for accepting Rs. 200,000 bribe
byline: A Quazi judge has been arrested on bribery charges after allegedly demanding and accepting a Rs. 200,000 bribe from a businessman in the Kandy area.

title: How is a new Pope elected?
byline: The centuries old process of the papal conclave - the election of a new Pope - is underway following the death of Pope Francis.

title: President extends condolences on passing away of Pope Francis
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake extended his heartfelt condolences on behalf of the people of Sri Lanka following the passing away of His Holiness Pope Francis.

title: 820 dansals registered within Kandy city limits
byline: A total of 820 Dansals have been registered within the Kandy city limits in conjunction with the exposition of the Sacred Tooth Relic, Chief Municipal Medical Officer of the Kandy Municipal Council Dr. Pasan Jayasinghe said.

title: 22 soldiers injured in bus-lorry collision
byline: Twenty-two soldiers were injured when a bus transporting army personnel collided with a lorry at the Manamala bend on the Nittambuwa–Kirindiwela road this morning.

title: Update: CA dismisses 60 writ petitions challenging rejection of nominations
byline: The Court of Appeal today ordered the dismissal of about 60 writ petitions filed challenging the rejection of nominations related to the Local Government elections.

title: Cardinal calls for independent prosecution office for Easter attack probe
byline: Archbishop of Colombo Cardinal Malcolm Ranjith today called on President Anura Kumara Dissanayake to establish an independent prosecution office specifically to hold accountable those responsible for the Easter Sunday bomb attacks that took place six years ago.

title: Wealthy Minds Academy faces SEC caution for reckless social media posts
byline: Sri Lanka’s Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC), the regulator of the capital market, has issued a notice of caution to Wealthy Minds Academy (Private) Limited and two of its directors for their reckless conduct in disseminating information on social media platforms regarding certain securities listed on the Colombo Stock Exchange (CSE).

title: Sri Lanka mourns the death of Pope
byline: The world including Sri Lanka received the news about the demise of Pope Francis, the spiritual head of 1.4 billion Catholics in the world making thousands across the globe to express their sadness on social media and through other means.

title: EC to sue public servants not providing details for LG Polls duties
byline: The Election Commission of Sri Lanka today warned legal action against public servants who will not provide necessary personal details and inventories of vehicle assets of state entities to be deployed in the duties of the upcoming Local Government elections, the Daily Mirror learns.

title: Ruling party unlikely to secure majority in most local bodies: RW
byline: Ruling National People’s Power (NPP) will not be successful at this year’s local government elections, and no party will get a clear majority in some of the bodies, former President Ranil Wickremesinghe said today.

title: No official ID cards for postal voting: Elections Commissioner General
byline: Elections Commissioner General Saman Sri Rathnayaka said that official ID cards will not be permitted for use when casting postal votes, due to issues that have arisen in the past, despite this option being previously allowed.

title: Spreading of viral infections a concern amid intermittent rainy weather: PHI Chairman
byline: The prevailing intermittent rainy weather conditions are contributing to the spread of viral infections among the people, Sri Lanka Public Health Inspectors’ Association Chairman Upul Rohana said.

title: Severe lightning warning issued for 13 districts
byline: A severe lightning warning has been issued today for 13 districts, the Meteorology Department said.

title: CSE opens the week steady as March quarter earnings season kicks off
byline: The Colombo Stock Exchange (CSE) opened the new week on a measured note as indices posted mild losses amid global uncertainty and cautious investor sentiment. Despite the slight pullback, the session reflected healthy underlying participation and sector-specific interest.

title: QR code system introduces for efficient waste management in  Kandy
byline: The Kandy Municipal Council has introduced a new QR code-based system to streamline waste management in the city during the special exposition of the Sacred Tooth Relic.

title: CEB ends renewable energy curtailment ahead of schedule
byline: The Ceylon Electricity Board (CEB) announced that the renewable energy curtailment, which began on April 10 ahead of the Sinhala and Tamil New Year holidays due to reduced electricity demand and the need to ensure grid stability, has concluded earlier than planned.
